summary: The Community News and Small Business Support Act proposes tax incentives to support local media. It provides a credit for small businesses that advertise in local media, up to $5,000 in the first year and $2,500 subsequently. It also offers a payroll credit for employers of local news journalists, aiming to support local journalism. The bill defines "local newspaper", "local news journalist" and sets limitations and other rules surrounding these credits including an end date to the credits.
